person.persName: Joseph Horace Lewis (Barren County, KY, attorney and CSA general)

body.p: Glasgow, Barren County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John and Elizabeth Reed Lewis. Married Sarah H. Rogers Lewis on November 29, 1845. Father of John Lewis, Sarah Lewis, George R. Lewis, and Eliza Lewis. Married Cassandra Flournoy Lewis in 1860. Graduated from Centre College in Danville, Kentucky, in 1843. Admitted to the bar in 1845. Attorney in Glasgow in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Glasgow in 1850. Whig member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1850 and 1852. Unsuccessful candidate for U.S. Congress in 1857 and 1861. Served in the 6th Kentucky Infantry (C.S.A.) as colonel from 1861 to 1863. Served in the 1st Kentucky Brigade (C.S.A.) as brevet brigadier general from September 20, 1863. Member of presidential escort during retreat of Jefferson Davis in 1865.
